qas.question: What state-owned organization operates New Delhi's bus transport system?
Delhi Transport Company owns the world's largest fleet of buses powered by what type of fuel?
What city has the highest number of registered cars of any city in India?
What large metropolis has some of the highest road density in India?
What type of vehicle transport system is owned by the Delhi Transport Corporation?

context: New Delhi has one of India's largest bus transport systems. <a4_0>Buses<a4_0/> are operated by the state-owned <a0_0>Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC)<a0_0/>, which owns largest fleet of <a1_0>compressed natural gas<a1_0/> (CNG)-fueled buses in the world. Personal vehicles especially cars also form a major chunk of vehicles plying on New Delhi roads. <a2_0>New Delhi<a2_0/> has the highest number of registered cars compared to any other metropolitan city in India. Taxis and Auto Rickshaws also ply on <a3_0>New Delhi<a3_0/> roads in large numbers. New Delhi has one of the highest road density in India.
